docs.text: ECCTY Seminar - Dallas November 8 - 9, 2022 Dallas, Texas Join the webex meeting to engage in chat Survey - Please provide your feedback! ECCTY 2022 Agenda Refer to the daily labs pages from the left-navigation section. Breakout Sessions Tuesday Nov 8th 1:15 PM - 2:15 PM CT ECCTY: DTCC - IBM BAW Breakout Roundtable – PART 1 LOCATION: Parry Conference Room: 177 S Belt Line Road Coppell, TX 750191 Process Mining Jeff Turner, Mat, Paul Pacholski Webex meeting link: Wednesday, Nov 9th. 10:55 AM - 12:30 PM CT ECCTY:DTCC - IBM BAW Breakout Roundtable – PART 2 LOCATION: Parry Conference Room: 177 S Belt Line Road Coppell, TX 750191 Containerization IID & Case Management/Filenet Jeff Turner, Owen Cline, Mat, Paul Pacholski, Rajesh Webex meeting link: Wednesday Nov 9th 2:30 PM - 4:00 PM CT ECCTY: DTCC - IBM Security Verify Access Roadmap - Q&A with Product Manager LOCATION: Parry Conference Room: 177 S Belt Line Road Coppell, TX 750191 IBM Security Verify Access Overview, New Features, Roadmap Other Topics to discuss MFA to T40 Mainframe client RACF and SV JSON Web Token (JWT) Q&A Webex meeting link: Presentations http://TBD Hands on Activities** From the navigation menu , select the Day 1 Labs and Day 2 Labs menu option. There, you will find the links to the hands-on lab guides and information to accces the Lab environments

docs.text: Day 1: Accessing lab environment Go to the Attendee Lab URL from the Day 1 Labs menu item, From the Day 1 Labs menu item , select the Lab Environment URL for the specific lab(s) you want to run Enter the workshop password: websphere and click Submit button Click the URL to your environment and enter the password that is displayed on the page, which is unique to your environment. The VMs will be shown, and should already be STARTED DO NOT start / stop VMs unless instructed to do so! You will see a screen with one or more VMs, depending on the specific lab. Follow the lab guide for instructions for accessing the specific VM, credentials, etc. Note: The lab guides include the information for which VM to open, how to login to the VM, login credentials, etc.
docs.title: Lab env
